edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.ot.uc

Class OTUCDDHOnGroupElementReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.ot.uc.OTUCDDHOnGroupElementReceiver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OTReceiver, Covert, Malicious, OneSidedSimulation, ProtocolSecLevel, SecurityLevel, SemiHonest, StandAlone, UC

    public class OTUCDDHOnGroupElementReceiver
extends java.lang.Object
implements OTReceiver, Malicious, UC
    Concrete class for OT receiver based on the DDH assumption that achieves UC security in the common reference string model.

    This implementation is based on the protocol of Peikert, Vaikuntanathan and Waters (CRYPTO 2008) for achieving UC-secure OT.

    This is implementation in GroupElement mode, derived from OTUCDDHReceiverAbs and implements the functionality related to the byte array inputs.

    The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 4.6 of pseudo codes document at http://cryptobiu.github.io/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode.pdf.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OTUCDDHOnGroupElementReceiver(DlogGroup dlog, GroupElement g0, GroupElement g1, GroupElement h0, GroupElement h1, java.security.SecureRandom random)
      Constructor that sets the given common reference string composed of a DLOG description (G,q,g0) and (g0,g1,h0,h1) which is a randomly chosen non-DDH tuple, kdf and random.

    • Method Detail

      • transfer

        public OTROutput transfer(Channel channel,
                 OTRInput input)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                          CheatAttemptException
        Run the transfer phase of the OT protocol.

        Transfer Phase (with input sigma)

        SAMPLE a random value r <- {0, . . . , q-1}

        COMPUTE

        4. g = (gSigma)^r

        5. h = (hSigma)^r

        SEND (g,h) to S

        WAIT for messages (u0,c0) and (u1,c1) from S

        IF NOT

        u0, u1, c0, c1 in G

        REPORT ERROR

        OUTPUT xSigma = cSigma * (uSigma)^(-r)

        Specified by:
        transfer in interface OTReceiver
        Parameters:
        channel - each call should get a different one.
        input - The parameters given in the input must match the DlogGroup member of this class, which given in the constructor.
        Returns:
        OTROutput, the output of the protocol.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the send or receive functions failed
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there was a problem during the serialization mechanism
        CheatAttemptException - if there was a cheat attempt during the execution of the protocol.
